body:
there was the usual ZMQ address already in use error in py3, so i just kicked travis. 

```
ERROR: simple print statement in kernel

----------------------------------------------------------------------

Traceback (most recent call last):

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/nose/case.py", line 198, in runTest

self.test(*self.arg)

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/tests/test_kernel.py", line 46, in test_simple_print

with kernel() as kc:

File "/usr/lib/python3.3/contextlib.py", line 48, in __enter__

return next(self.gen)

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/tests/utils.py", line 111, in kernel

yield start_global_kernel()

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/tests/utils.py", line 97, in start_global_kernel

KM, KC = start_new_kernel()

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/tests/utils.py", line 54, in start_new_kernel

kc.get_shell_msg(block=True, timeout=STARTUP_TIMEOUT)

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/client.py", line 85, in get_shell_msg

return self.shell_channel.get_msg(*args, **kwargs)

File "/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/blocking/channels.py", line 44, in get_msg

return self._in_queue.get(block, timeout)

File "/usr/lib/python3.3/queue.py", line 175, in get

raise Empty

nose.proxy.Empty:

-------------------- >> begin captured logging << --------------------

root: DEBUG: Connecting to: tcp://127.0.0.1:36780

root: DEBUG: connecting shell channel to tcp://127.0.0.1:48927

root: DEBUG: connecting iopub channel to tcp://127.0.0.1:51874

root: DEBUG: connecting stdin channel to tcp://127.0.0.1:50125

root: DEBUG: connecting heartbeat channel to tcp://127.0.0.1:39196

--------------------- >> end captured logging << ---------------------

>> begin captured subprocess output <<

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

ZMQError Traceback (most recent call last)

<string> in <module>()

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/zmq/kernelapp.py in main()

466 """Run an IPKernel as an application"""

467 app = IPKernelApp.instance()

--> 468 app.initialize()

app.initialize = <bound method IPKernelApp.initialize of <IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object at 0x7f2f68305b10>>

469 app.start()

470

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/zmq/kernelapp.py in initialize(self=<IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object>, argv=None)

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/config/application.py in catch_config_error(method=<function IPKernelApp.initialize>, app=<IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object>, *args=(None,), **kwargs={})

90 """

91 try:

---> 92 return method(app, *args, **kwargs)

method = <function IPKernelApp.initialize at 0x7f2f61fb9560>

app = <IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object at 0x7f2f68305b10>

args = (None,)

kwargs = {}

93 except (TraitError, ArgumentError) as e:

94 app.print_help()

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/zmq/kernelapp.py in initialize(self=<IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object>, argv=None)

433 self.init_session()

434 self.init_poller()

--> 435 self.init_sockets()

self.init_sockets = <bound method IPKernelApp.init_sockets of <IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object at 0x7f2f68305b10>>

436 self.init_heartbeat()

437 # writing/displaying connection info must be *after* init_sockets/heartbeat

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/zmq/kernelapp.py in init_sockets(self=<IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object>)

311

312 self.control_socket = context.socket(zmq.ROUTER)

--> 313 self.control_port = self._bind_socket(self.control_socket, self.control_port)

self.control_port = 36780

self._bind_socket = <bound method IPKernelApp._bind_socket of <IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object at 0x7f2f68305b10>>

self.control_socket = <zmq.sugar.socket.Socket object at 0x7f2f61f07390>

314 self.log.debug("control ROUTER Channel on port: %i" % self.control_port)

315

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/IPython/kernel/zmq/kernelapp.py in _bind_socket(self=<IPython.kernel.zmq.kernelapp.IPKernelApp object>, s=<zmq.sugar.socket.Socket object>, port=36780)

215 port = s.bind_to_random_port(iface)

216 else:

--> 217 s.bind("tcp://%s:%i" % (self.ip, port))

s.bind = <built-in method bind of Socket object at 0x7f2f61f07390>

self.ip = '127.0.0.1'

port = 36780

218 elif self.transport == 'ipc':

219 if port <= 0:

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/pyzmq-14.1.1-py3.3-linux-x86_64.egg/zmq/backend/cython/socket.cpython-33m.so in zmq.backend.cython.socket.Socket.bind (zmq/backend/cython/socket.c:4126)()

/home/travis/virtualenv/python3.3/lib/python3.3/site-packages/pyzmq-14.1.1-py3.3-linux-x86_64.egg/zmq/backend/cython/socket.cpython-33m.so in zmq.backend.cython.checkrc._check_rc (zmq/backend/cython/socket.c:6174)()

ZMQError: Address already in use

>> end captured subprocess output <<
```

Happy to. Can you point me at the existing tests for this file? Hopefully
it'll be clear how to add a test case to cover the changes.

--Adam

On Fri, Mar 21, 2014 at 10:10 AM, Min RK notifications@github.com wrote:

> Can you add a test?
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/5405#issuecomment-38299038
> .
Can you demonstrate a failure case for this in master? I know there were problems quite some time ago, but I can't reproduce the problem with the current development version of IPython.

Sorry, I haven't had more time to spend on this. We were seeing problems in
IPython 1.1, not sure about more recent versions.

But these kinds of input lines were causing crashes:

s = '±¹¹ÎÀºÇà' s print '±¹¹ÎÀºÇà'

--Adam

On Tue, Mar 25, 2014 at 3:29 PM, Thomas Kluyver notifications@github.comwrote:

> Can you demonstrate a failure case for this in master? I know there were
> problems quite some time ago, but I can't reproduce the problem with the
> current development version of IPython.
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/5405#issuecomment-38629502
> .

Those lines work for me in master and in some 1.x release I've got installed. It could be that something was broken in 1.1 and fixed by the version I've got installed. Or it could be environment dependent. What's your OS, and what's `IPython.utils.encoding.DEFAULT_ENCODING`?

OS is Ubuntu 12.04 LTS, IPython.utils.encoding.DEFAULT_ENCODING is 'UTF-8'.

Interestingly, commands like

print '±¹¹ÎÀºÇà'

work fine when I run IPython locally (with logging enabled), but cause a
crash in IPython built from my company's source repository (IPython 1.1,
same OS and default encoding). Guess I'll need to investigate further.

--Adam

On Tue, Mar 25, 2014 at 4:16 PM, Thomas Kluyver notifications@github.comwrote:

> Those lines work for me in master and in some 1.x release I've got
> installed. It could be that something was broken in 1.1 and fixed by the
> version I've got installed. Or it could be environment dependent. What's
> your OS, and what's IPython.utils.encoding.DEFAULT_ENCODING?
> 
> ## 
> 
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHubhttps://github.com/ipython/ipython/pull/5405#issuecomment-38633342
> .

Is the second case going over SSH? That could well have a different environment.

Anyway, it looks like the issue is more subtle - I'm going to close the PR, but feel free to open an issue if you think there's a problem that can be reproduced in current IPython.
